1.text: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus according to the commandment of God our Saviour, and Christ Jesus our hope;

2.text: unto Timothy, my true child in faith: Grace, mercy, peace, from God the Father and Christ Jesus our Lord.

3.text: As I exhorted thee to tarry at Ephesus, when I was going into Macedonia, that thou mightest charge certain men not to teach a different doctrine,

4.text: neither to give heed to fables and endless genealogies, which minister questionings, rather than a dispensation of God which is in faith; so do I now.

5.text: But the end of the charge is love out of a pure heart and a good conscience and faith unfeigned:

6.text: from which things some having swerved have turned aside unto vain talking;

7.text: desiring to be teachers of the law, though they understand neither what they say, nor whereof they confidently affirm.

8.text: But we know that the law is good, if a man use it lawfully,

9.text: as knowing this, that law is not made for a righteous man, but for the lawless and unruly, for the ungodly and sinners, for the unholy and profane, for murderers of fathers and murderers of mothers, for manslayers,

10.text: for fornicators, for abusers of themselves with men, for menstealers, for liars, for false swearers, and if there be any other thing contrary to the sound doctrine;

11.text: according to the gospel of the glory of the blessed God, which was committed to my trust.

12.text: I thank him that enabled me, even Christ Jesus our Lord, for that he counted me faithful, appointing me to his service;

13.text: though I was before a blasphemer, and a persecutor, and injurious: howbeit I obtained mercy, because I did it ignorantly in unbelief;

14.text: and the grace of our Lord abounded exceedingly with faith and love which is in Christ Jesus.

15.text: Faithful is the saying, and worthy of all acceptation, that Christ Jesus came into the world to save sinners; of whom I am chief:

16.text: howbeit for this cause I obtained mercy, that in me as chief might Jesus Christ show forth all his longsuffering, for an ensample of them that should thereafter believe on him unto eternal life.

17.text: Now unto the King eternal, immortal, invisible, the only God, be honor and glory for ever and ever. Amen.

18.text: This charge I commit unto thee, my child Timothy, according to the prophecies which led the way to thee, that by them thou mayest war the good warfare;

19.text: holding faith and a good conscience; which some having thrust from them made shipwreck concerning the faith:

20.text: of whom is Hymen√¶us and Alexander; whom I delivered unto Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.
